intro: Lysiosepalum barryanum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and produces small, oval-shaped berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
